questions.question_text:
A company uses Dynamics 365 Finance. The company experiences performance issues with several forms in production.

You need to use Live View SQL performance metrics to identity potential issues that occur in real time.

You need to recommend a solution to troubleshoot performance issues.

Which two performance metrics should the company use? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
Update: A & D
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/lifecycle-services/performancetroubleshooting

Selected Answer: CD
See https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/relational-databases/performance/live-query-statistics and the graphic under heading for: To view live query statistics for any query

questions.question_text:
A customer is preparing to upgrade to a new version of Dynamics 365 Finance.

Unit testing is required prior to the upgrade.

You need to recommend a testing tool for unit testing.

Which tool should you recommend?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C = SysTest. SysTest framework is a Unit test framework. Link: https://www.oreilly.com/library/view/implementing-microsoft-dynamics/9781787283336/772e7e5f-a600-426f-ace2-3b8f73bb0c70.xhtml

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.

After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.

A company implements Dynamics 365 Finance.

Forms and reports take longer than usual to open and run in the production environment.

You need to investigate the performance issue by using SQL Insights in Lifecycle Services (LCS).

Solution: Get table fragmentation details and index rebuild suggestions.

Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
You can't retrieve index details or rebuild indexes anymore through LCS. See deprecation notice here:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/lifecycle-services/querycookbook

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/fin-ops/get-started/removed-deprecated-features-platform-updates#azure-sql-actions-in-lifecycle-services

Answer > B

Selected Answer: B
Could be a solution but if you need a solution now , you need to investigate for blocking statement or long execution statement.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
A client is implementing Dynamics 365.
The client is exploring the available testing options.
You need to recommend which tool should be used based on the requirement.
What should you recommend? To answer, drag the appropriate types to the correct requirements. Each tool may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content: I think the solution is correct

I would say both "Validate control gesture"
A validate control gesture is a type of control gesture that lets you compare the value of a control on the user interface (UI) with an expected value. You can use this gesture to verify that the invoice amount matches the expected amount for a sales order.

A test case operator is a type of operator that lets you perform logical operations on test cases, such as branching, looping, or calling other test cases. You can use this operator to create complex test scenarios, but not to check the invoice amount.

An info step control gesture is a type of control gesture that lets you add an informational message to the test case. You can use this gesture to provide additional details or instructions for the test case, but not to check the invoice amount

comments.content: I think the solution is correct is not necessary to add an info step.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

A company uses Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management.

You are performing regression testing using the Regression suite automation tool (RSAT). You observe that invoice totals for some sales orders are lower than expected.

You need to ensure that the invoice totals are correct.

What should you do? To answer, drag the appropriate actions to the correct scenarios. Each action may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//
